channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Gautam Adani's U.S. fraud charges could have wider repercussions for India
item.description: U.S. prosecutors allege that Gautam Adani, the second most-wealthy Indian man, personally met with Indian government officials to further their "bribery scheme."

item.title: Japan's October headline inflation rate falls, but economists still see BOJ rate hike on the table
item.description: Core inflation came in at 2.3%, down from September's 2.4% but higher than the 2.2% that was expected.

item.title: Bitcoin hits fresh record, marches toward $100,000 as rally continues
item.description: Bitcoin breached the $99,000 level for the first time as investors continued pricing in a second Donald Trump presidency.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Expectations can be an irrational thing. Just look at Nvidia
item.description: If investors expect a company to make a huge loss and it manages to make a dollar in profit, shares are likely to rise. An exaggeration, but still.

item.title: In forgotten parts of Singapore's iconic Orchard Road shopping street, a new era is taking shape
item.description: Orchard Road, Singapore's main shopping street, is 2.2 km (1.3 miles) long but much of the activity takes place in the middle of the stretch.

item.title: Bluesky CEO Jay Graber says X rival is 'billionaire proof'
item.description: Bluesky CEO Jay Graber told CNBC that the social media app's open design could thwart potential acquisition efforts.

item.title: SailGP signs Rolex as first title partner of its global sailing competition
item.description: SailGP's global championship features a dozen national teams battling in identical high-tech, high-speed 50-foot foiling catamarans.

item.title: ‘Gladiator II’ star Denzel Washington recalls ‘hoarding cans of food’ early in his career
item.description: The 69-year-old told British Vogue he knew he had "made it" once he stopped.

item.title: Morgan Stanley CEO is bullish on stocks, says the U.S. economy is 'outperforming'
item.description: Ted Pick said that the U.S. and China have a mutually unified motivation to find solutions that could benefit both economies.

item.title: The founder of the biggest gold ETF is still bullish 20 years later
item.description: State Street's chief gold strategist reflects on how his gold-tracking ETF has changed the commodity investing landscape over the last two decades.

item.title: Adani vs. Hindenburg: How one of India's biggest empires descended into chaos
item.description: A timeline of Adani Group headlines since the publication of Hindenburg's report.

item.title: Citadel's Ken Griffin says Trump's tariffs could lead to crony capitalism
item.description: "I am gravely concerned that the rise of tariffs puts us on a slippery slope towards crony capitalism," the billionaire investor said.

item.title: Gap shares surge as it raises guidance, touts 'strong start' to holiday
item.description: Gap said Old Navy's sales fell after hurricanes led to store closures and warm weather deterred sales in its kids category.

item.title: Intuit shares drop as quarterly forecast misses estimates due to delayed revenue
item.description: While Intuit reiterated its full-year view, the company said promotional changes in the current quarter will have implications for revenue timing.

item.title: Jim Cramer's big takeaway from the market reaction to Nvidia's earnings beat
item.description: The Investing Club holds its "Morning Meeting" every weekday at 10:20 a.m. ET.

item.title: Alphabet shares slide 4% following DOJ push for Google to divest Chrome
item.description: Alphabet shares fell after the Department of Justice proposed that Google divest its Chrome browser to end its search monopoly.

item.title: Trump and Fed Chair Powell could be set on a collision course over interest rates
item.description: Though Powell became Fed chair in 2018, after Trump nominated him for the position, the two clashed often about the direction of interest rates.

item.title: Britain’s 'mini-budget' disaster should serve as a warning to the U.S., bond strategists say
item.description: Fears are mounting that the U.S. could soon experience its own version of Britain's "mini-budget" crisis.

item.title: SEC Chair Gary Gensler will step down Jan. 20, make way for Trump replacement
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has not announced his pick, but the expectation is that the next chair will be friendlier to Wall Street and cryptocurrencies.

item.title: Nvidia shares fluctuate as investors digest third-quarter earnings
item.description: Despite nearly doubling sales year on year, Nvidia's third-quarter results show a slowdown from previous quarters.

item.title: Baidu posts 3% drop in third-quarter revenues, beating market expectations
item.description: Beijing-based Baidu operates one of the major web browser search engines in China, along with a frequently used maps app.

item.title: Snowflake rockets 32%, its best day ever, after earnings beat
item.description: Snowflake reported better-than-expected results on the top and bottom lines.

item.title: British regulators will soon announce competition remedies for the multibillion-pound cloud industry
item.description: The U.K. competition regulator will soon announce "behavioral" remedies to address anti-competitive practices in the cloud industry, two sources told CNBC.

item.title: Nvidia says it will sell more of its next-generation Blackwell chips than previously anticipated
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday signaled that Blackwell sales over the next few quarters will be limited by how many chips and systems it can make.

item.title: DOJ pushes for Google to break off Chrome browser after antitrust case
item.description: The Department of Justice is pushing a federal judge to make Google divest its Chrome internet browser as a remedy following the antitrust case.

item.title: Rafael Nadal has made $134 million in career prize money, will retire as No. 2 highest-earning tennis player ever
item.description: The 38-year-old's career earnings are surpassed only by Novak Djokovic's.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Could Nvidia’s greatest obstacle be itself?
item.description: There’s a concept called the “hedonic treadmill," which theorizes as people achieve success, their expectations rise. Nvidia seems a victim of this.

item.title: Adani investor GQG Partners' shares see worst day after Gautam Adani's indictment
item.description: The stock closed 19.32% lower on Thursday, the investment firm's steepest one-day fall since its listing on Oct. 2021.

item.title: Thailand legalizing same-sex marriage is likely to bring a flood of tourists
item.description: Thailand's same-sex marriage law could add 4 million tourists and $2 billion in tourism revenue per year, according to a report commissioned by Agoda.

item.title: Nvidia nearly doubles revenue on strong AI demand
item.description: Nvidia reported earnings after the bell. Here are the results.
